oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military depots; People; Wooden buildings; Historic buildings; Storehouses; Warehouses; Guards; Standing
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; United States - Army - Quartermaster Corps; Rusling, James Fowler, 1834-1918; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front view of Taylor Depot. A Civil War soldier is visible in the image. An inscription in the lower left corner reads, "James F. Rusling, Nash."

This was a commissary warehouse (1st section: 287 ft long x 190 ft wide, 2 stories high; 2nd section 230 ft long x 190 ft Wide, 2 stories high). It was located near 6th Avenue South and Lafayette Street, Nashville.
